author: CoffeeBrickMan
title: Quick Mini Review
review:
Burnard is the third of the Series 4 Mixels of the Infernites Tribe.

He looks really fantastic, great expression, cool eye construction and a big flaming tongue. He looks like mischevious trouble.

Lots of dark red and trans-orange decorative parts, the big flame piece, red flat hinges and those eye constructions look useful.

Quick build time just over 3½ minutes.

Note: The inventory in the instructions is incorrect (the Brickset parts list is fine). It lists 1x Red Roof Tile 1x2 - when there are 2, and  1x Roof Tile 1x1x2/3 - when there are 6. Most of these are used on his feet, which can be clearly seen in his picture!

Burnard is my favourite Infernite and would be quite high on my overall list. He looks like so much fun.

Infernites Max

This Max (a combination of the 3 members of the tribe) is pretty chunky. His tail and flaming tongue are connected by a small sliding construction through the middle of his body. I'm not quite sure what that's supposed to represent.  He is fun with plenty of articulation, but he does seems like a bit of a mish mash from the parts.

Quick build time just over 7½ minutes.

author: Slobrojoe
title: How would you like your steak? Medium rare?
review:
Mixels has brought new meanings to the Lego world in cheap form. The inexpensive series are bringing new parts for very little expenses. Despite being very MOCable, is the set decent? This is Burnard from series 4 mixels.

Box/Instructions 

This set comes in a recyclable plastic bag that is hard to keep intact if you want to preserve the packaging. The instructions are a 23 page easy to follow guide. These are folded over in the bag.

Minifigs

The set has no minifigs.

Parts

Most of the parts are red with a few white pieces. The best piece is the long yellow and red flame. Some pieces are transparent. There are no stickers.

Build

The build is quite simple, taking between 5 and 7 minutes.

The completed model

His arms can move 85 degrees. His eyes can also be rotated. There is a huge flame coming out of his mouth.

What more could you want from a £3 ($4) collectible set? One of the best the in the series.
